channel.title: Server status page remodel
channel.description:
I brought this up with Moparisthebest yesterday and he didn't really see much of an issue with the current status page but I think it really needs improving. It needs to be restyled, credits to Unhandled for when it was done but it's a little out of touch now, or at least that's what it feels like to me. As an RSPS community a big feature of our site is the status page, arguably as big as the forums are so it needs to be as presentable and as user-friendly as can possibly be. Another few things functionality wise I suggested at the time and have thought of since:
[ul][li]Remove the 1 hour vote rule, make it 24 like the rest.[/li] [li]Add support for further revisions other than just the two at the minute.[/li] [li]Include an array of callback and incentive systems so it's easier for the communities to be sure someone has voted.[/li] [li]Add in how many people have clicked the link to that server.[/li] [li]A possible feedback feature on the server? People can provide feedback directly there and then.[/li] [li]Remove the advertisements when you click to view their information, make that page centered around the server.[/li][/ul]
I can't think of anything more at the minute, but those are my current ideas. I'm more or less posting this to get some community feedback and hopefully if there's enough people support the idea we can push for it to be done.
So.. Thoughts?

item.title: Server status page remodel
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I just added the ability to check if a certain IP has voted in the last X seconds (by default, 24 hours). This is how you would do it:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?action=check_ip&server=fire-blades.no-ip.org&ip=127.0.0.1

That will return the number of times that IP has voted for that server in the last 24 hours. If you want a different period of time, specify the seconds you want to go back:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?action=check_ip&server=fire-blades.no-ip.org&ip=127.0.0.1&since=3600

That will return the number of times that IP has voted for that server in the last 1 hour (3600 seconds).

I also plan to eventually add real-time ‘callback’ functionality, but go ahead and give me any feedback on this functionality for now.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

The php code tags are really loveed on here hik, if you include <?php it doubles the input of them and it just confuses people. They’re really temperamental so I just avoid using them and use [ php] tags instead.

item.title: Server status page remodel
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:42, topic:518639”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=636905.msg4294385#msg4294385 date=1367949617]
Please use a PHP framework so us scrubs can actually understand what is going on. PHP Cake/Codeigniter maybe?
[/quote]
It won’t be anything complex, merely just taking information from a database so you’ll be able to see what I’m doing. It’ll literally be something like this:
[php]
include(’./db.connector_vars.php’);

$con = new mysqli($host, $user, $pass, $db);

$sql = “SELECT * FROM tbl_name LIMIT 6 DESC”;

/**

  • No need to prepare the statement since it’s constructed by a non-malicious source. Just
  • stating that because it’s guaranteed someone would bring it up.
    */
    $res = $con->query($sql);

if($row = $res->fetch_assoc()) {
/**

  • Some form of data to echo
    */
    }

$con->close();
[/php][/quote]lol i thought you used color tags to make syntax highlighting yourself. y not use code tags?

[code=php]
include(’./db.connector_vars.php’);

$con = new mysqli($host, $user, $pass, $db);

$sql = “SELECT * FROM tbl_name LIMIT 6 DESC”;

/**

  • No need to prepare the statement since it’s constructed by a non-malicious source. Just
  • stating that because it’s guaranteed someone would bring it up.
    */
    $res = $con->query($sql);

if($row = $res->fetch_assoc()) {
/**

  • Some form of data to echo
    */
    }

$con->close();[/code]

looks better and easier to read imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Server status page remodel
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

sinisoul:

Please use a PHP framework so us scrubs can actually understand what is going on. PHP Cake/Codeigniter maybe?

It won’t be anything complex, merely just taking information from a database so you’ll be able to see what I’m doing. It’ll literally be something like this:
[php]
include(’./db.connector_vars.php’);

$con = new mysqli($host, $user, $pass, $db);

$sql = “SELECT * FROM tbl_name LIMIT 6 DESC”;

/**

  • No need to prepare the statement since it’s constructed by us, not user input. Just
  • stating that because it’s guaranteed someone would bring it up.
    */
    $res = $con->query($sql);

if($row = $res->fetch_assoc()) {
/**

  • Some form of data to echo
    */
    }

$con->close();
[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: Server status page remodel
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Support, theirs quite a few good ideas here.

Tbh looking at the page, it doesn’t look nice to the eye and it could use most of the features suggested here. Back when I used to play RSPS I wouldn’t ever search for servers via the moparscape status page and I knew nobody that did (exl. people from moparscape), I think moparscape is loosing a lot of traffic because of the current page. The page is good n all etc but I think it can be improved a lot. More people will surely join the community too if it’s reworked ‘correctly’.

Read full topic
